result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Anthony Charles Nelson was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Lifetime revocation of driver's license. If eligible, may apply for reinstatement through the Department of Transportation after 10 years. (Call the Department of Transportation with questions).

The Department of Transportation will determine the length of an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) requirement if defendant obtains eligibility for a valid driver's license through the Department. Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed in all vehicles registered under Defendant's name. IID shall be installed prior to Defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued by the Department of Transportation. Call the Department of Transportation with questions and for eligibility date.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

miscConds.notes: $3,851.00 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription.

No alcohol.

No possession of anyone else's financial instruments/information.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes:
72 days conditional jail. Subject to good time and work release. Must serve first 48 hours without work release. Must report to jail immediately after hearing.
Consecutive to: conditional jail in 21CT19.

Banked jail for use by Probation if necessary. Not subject to good time.
Consecutive to: banked jail in 21CT19.

CASES: 21CT19 & 21CT21, 21CM202. 3:40 PM Defendant Anthony Charles Nelson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Anthony Charles Nelson.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. 

SENTENCE re jail time:
21CT19 OWI 3rd: 110 days conditional time ordered is consecutive to OWI 4th and the 72 days conditional jail (new case # to be generated for felony file). 
CT orders 3 months banked jail on 21CT19 OWI 3rd. 3 months banked jail ordered on OWI 4th (new case #) and is consecutive to 21CT19. 
Everything else remains as ordered on both files from sentencing on 6/20/22. 3:46 pm adj.
Status hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form
21CT21 (Amended Complaint filed 6/20/22 with OWI 4th changing the severity to a felony)

CASES: 21CT19, 21CT21, 21CM202. 1:37 PM Defendant Anthony Charles Nelson in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Anthony Charles Nelson.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA addresses ct re resolution on all files. 
21CT19: OWI 3rd count 1- def- G plea. 
21CT21: State will be filing an amended complaint re OWI 4th. New case number on felony charge will be generated.  Def waives any right to PH. CT questions def. CT finds waiver is made FK&V. Paper copies of complaint and an information were provided to court. CT finds PC, def bound over. On amended count 1 on OWI 4th: def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. 
Count 5 in 21CT19 M&D.  Count 2 re OWI 4th M&D.  Remaining counts dismissed on state's motion. 21CM202 RI&D on state's motion.  
Def requests to waive PSI on OWI 4th. CT finds waiver of PSI is made FK&V. Arguments. 

SENTENCE:
21CT19 OWI 3rd: W/held sent 2 years probation. 110 days conditional jail. Must report to jail immediately after hearing. Subj to GT and WR after first 48 hours. $4026.00 fine/costs, includes $200 DNA surcharge, DNA sample. 3 years revoked DL, 3 years IID. AODA and comply.

OWI 4th count 1 (case # to be generated):  W/held 3 years probation. 72 days conditional jail. Consecutive to 21CT19. Subj to GT and WR after first 48 hours. $4,101.00 fine/costs, includes $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Probation conditions on both cases: AS. No drugs without a prescription. No alcohol.  No possession of anyone else's financial instruments.  6 months banked jail for probation. Not subj to GT. 43 days credit. Any treatment/programming per agent. 
3 years IID. Lifetime revocation of DL, may apply for reinstatement after 10 years. AODA and comply. PCR. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 2:17 pm adj.
